text: We must secure clean drinking water for Navajo Nation in Utah. After this bill passed unanimously in the Senate, we're urging House Democratic Leadership to bring this critical legislation to the floor for consideration without delay. https://www.romney.senate.gov/romney-and-mcadams-push-passage-utah-navajo-water-bill

COVID-19 has disproportionately impacted Utah's Navajo Nation, and the shortage of running water in nearly half of homes contributes to the spread. Each day House Democratic Leadership holds up the Navajo Utah Water Rights Settlement Act, the hardship on Utah Navajos continues.

There is zero evidence of widespread voter fraud from mail-in voting—yet PA GOP tried to use this claim to cut back the state’s deadline for mail-in ballots at the last minute. They came up short—for now. We must remain vigilant in the fight against disgraceful voter suppression. https://twitter.com/cnnbrk/status/1321566996639735809 QT @cnnbrk The Supreme Court won't expedite the latest GOP challenge to Pennsylvania mail-in ballot rules https://trib.al/xWfPwVv

Social media platforms need to be ready on Election Day with policies along these lines, and clearly and transparently communicate how these policies will be enforced. Our democracy is counting on it.

(3) Content Delegitimizing the Election. Content that baselessly delegitimizes the election—content designed to sow doubt and division—should not be amplified by the algorithms used on social media platforms.

(2) Voter Protection Preclearance. Just as live network TV institutes a short delay to prevent unacceptable content from airing, social media platforms can institute a short delay on content from specific high-reach accounts to allow for human review (h/t @accountabletech)

(1) Viral Circuit Breakers. Too often on social media, lies spread faster than the truth. A viral circuit breaker would slow the spread of viral content about the election until content moderators can conduct an effective review for accuracy.

This new report from @amprog offers up some common-sense ideas for how: https://www.americanprogress.org/issues/technology-policy/reports/2020/10/23/492232/results-not-found-addressing-social-medias-threat-democratic-legitimacy-public-safety-election-day

Social media companies have a responsibility to control the spread of election misinformation on their platforms. They can ensure Americans’ freedom to speak out while protecting the legitimacy of our democratic process and the public’s safety—and they must. Thread 👇

COVID-19 has taken a devastating toll on Indian Country. By suppressing this report, certain members of the @USCCRgov have shown the need for more scrutiny – not less – of this administration’s failure to uphold its responsibilities to Native Americans.

This vote to censor updates to the “Broken Promises” report & any @USCCRgov statement on COVID's impact on Native Americans is disgraceful. It reinforces the US government's painful pattern of minimizing Native Americans' needs & disregarding its obligations to these communities.

In May, @RepDebHaaland and I asked @USCCRgov to update its landmark report on the government's failures to Native communities, now to address the COVID crisis. The update is done, but you can't read it because GOP appointees voted to block its release. https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/senator-warren-and-congresswoman-haaland-condemn-republican-appointees-censorship-of-important-new-report-on-the-pandemics-impact-on-native-nations
